forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
NTFS (and also ANY other Filesystem) takes some space for the internal filesystems structures. NTFS needs more of this when compared to FAT or FAT32.  

With "clean" I was referring to the "diskpart clean" command you gave, no, it is not the same as "formatting", it is more similar to FDISK, but you need not to worry, you have it working, that's all you need for now.  

After installing grub4dos, you edit the menu.lst, adding an entry as the given link. (NOTEPAD will do)  
You may want to read the grub4dos guide and experiment with Command Line in grub4dos, too.  

A "normal" MBR is 1 sector long (512 bytes) and is the FIRST sector on a disk.  
After it come a number of hidden sectors (usually 62) that are normally empty, but re-read:  
[http://www.boot-land...?...=8965\&st=18](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=8965&st=18 "External link")  

If you install grldr.mbr to the MBR, the PBR won't be "used", again re-read:  
[http://www.boot-land...?...=8965\&st=18](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=8965&st=18 "External link")  

jaclaz
